Rule.NonCompliantComment: The AppArmor framework is not enabled on the system.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Enable the AppArmor framework and ensure it is running in enforce mode.
Rule.Correction: systemctl enable apparmor; systemctl start apparmor
Rule.Verification: aa-status | grep -q "profiles are in enforce mode" && echo 0 || echo 1

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The Apache AppArmor profile is not properly configured.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Review and adjust the Apache AppArmor profile as per best practices.
Rule.Correction: Manual review required; update /etc/apparmor.d/usr.sbin.apache2 as needed

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The Apache AppArmor profile is not in enforce mode.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Set the Apache AppArmor profile to enforce mode.
Rule.Verification: aa-status | grep "usr.sbin.apache2" | grep -q "enforce mode" && echo 0 || echo 1
